conversation.content: I build decks for high-end clients, including the mayor's office, and I need this charge delayed.

Got it got it okay so I'm looking at account number ACC-4521-BX here and I see a pending charge for $8,750.42 that's set to process tonight at midnight which is... what's the word... substantial for sure.
That's supposed to hit Monday—no wait, Tuesday. Tuesday after my client pays.

Right so here's what I can tell you the system shows this as a pre-authorized charge from October 28th for order MDL-9982-K and once those are in the queue they process automatically after the hold period expires which is unfortunately not something I can override.
Do you understand what happens if this hits before the Hendersons pay me?

Absolutely and I hear you I really do but let me see here... hmm what if... okay so the charge hits in approximately 6 hours but I could potentially split it into two transactions of $4,375.21 each if that would help with your cash flow situation?
That doesn't solve anything. Of course this would happen right when I actually need flexibility.

Okay okay wait wait I'm seeing something interesting here your account has a credit line available of $12,000 that's currently unused so technically the charge could process against that instead of your checking which would give you until November 30th to pay it off interest-free.
I've been a preferred contractor for eight years and you're telling me there's nothing—sorry, absolutely nothing you can do?

Well that's the thing I can't stop the charge but what I can do is set up an instant transfer from your credit line for exactly $8,750.42 to cover it and then you'd have that grace period I mentioned plus if you pay within 72 hours there's actually a 2% cashback bonus.
Why wasn't this credit option mentioned when I placed the order?

That's weird actually because... let me think... okay so normally orders over $5,000 trigger an automatic prompt about financing but your order MDL-9982-K shows it was placed through our contractor portal which might've bypassed that whole...
Every other supplier holds charges until the date I specify. Every single one.

Right right I get that and honestly our system is kind of... it's built more for retail than contractors which is why we have these workarounds but listen I can also add a note here with priority flag PRY-7734 for our commercial team to contact you about our new flex-pay program.
Just... whatever. Transfer the credit to cover it.

Perfect yes okay so I'm initiating transfer TRN-8845-QZ right now for the full $8,750.42 and you'll get a confirmation text in about thirty seconds with all the details about the November 30th deadline.
And this won't affect my material delivery Friday—actually no, Thursday?
Nope.
Fine. At least something works today.

Okay so you're all set the transfer is processing and just so you know for future orders if you use code FLEX30 at checkout it automatically sets up that 30-day payment delay without having to call in or do this whole credit line dance.
